data.value: Given the Zeros, Poles and Gain of a digital filter, compute its frequency response:
If a single integer, then compute at that many frequencies (default is N=512).
If an array_like, compute the response at the frequencies given. These are in the same units as
Normally, frequencies are computed from 0 to the Nyquist frequency, fs/2 (upper-half of unit-circle). If
is True, compute frequencies from 0 to fs. Ignored if w is array_like.
The sampling frequency of the digital system. Defaults to 2*pi radians/sample (so w is from 0 to pi).
was computed, in the same units as
is normalized to the range [0, pi) (radians/sample).
The frequency response, as complex numbers.
Compute the frequency response of a digital filter in ZPK form.
Design a 4th-order digital Butterworth filter with cut-off of 100 Hz in a system with sample rate of 1000 Hz, and plot the frequency response:
Compute the frequency response of an analog filter in TF form
Compute the frequency response of an analog filter in ZPK form
Compute the frequency response of a digital filter in TF form

signature.value: freqz_zpk(z, p, k, worN=512, whole=False, fs=6.283185307179586)
